{{Exclusive|java}}

A '''jukebox song''' is a song played when an item with the {{cd|minecraft:jukebox_playable}} item data component is inserted into a {{BlockLink|jukebox}}. Jukebox songs can be defined using [[JSON]] files in a [[data pack]] at the path {{cd|data/<namespace>/jukebox_song/}}.

== JSON format ==
Jukebox songs are defined using the following format:
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}} The root object.
** {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|compound|sound_event}}: {{json ref|sound event|inline=1}} &mdash; The [[sound event]] to play when the item is inserted in a jukebox. Note that only vanilla ''Minecraft'' sound events can be referenced directly by {{nbt|string}} ID; custom sound events must be specified in {{nbt|compound}} object form.
*** {{nbt inherit/sound event}}
** {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|compound|description}}: A [[text component]] to display in the tooltip of the item.
** {{nbt|float|length_in_seconds}}: The length of the song in seconds. Determines the length of the redstone output of the jukebox. If the sound is longer, it is cut off after this time.
** {{nbt|int|comparator_output}}: Value between 0 and 15 &mdash; The redstone power output by a [[comparator]] when placed next to a jukebox playing this song.
</div>
